title: Windows 8.1 Final With Update 3 Build 9600 Pro + Core
description:
Now again Microsoft has released November Update Rollup for Windows 8.1 which can be assumed as Update 3 or service pack 3, etc. It doesn’t matter whether its a simple update or a major update, the important thing is that every Windows 8.1 user should install it as it provides various fixes and improvements.

The new November update rollup contains many issue fixes and performance and reliability improvements. It also includes all previous updates since the last update released in April 2014.

November update rollup includes following new features and improvements:

Support for newer hardware (boot order allowance, SD card improvements, USB debugging)
Additional hardware support (devices that have third-party disk encryption software enabled can now be upgraded to Windows 8.1 more easily)
Improved Web Services for Devices (WSD) printer support during network switches
Refreshed language packs
Performance and reliability improvements in clustered virtual machine mission-critical environments
Improved manageability
Defence-in-depth security and Schannel hardening
This update also fixes following annoying issues reported by users:

“0x0000009F” Stop error when you connect a dock or a keyboard to a device in Windows RT 8.1
Excel freezes for a short time when you open an Excel workbook on a network share in Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1
Bluetooth device cannot reconnect to the computer in Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1
You cannot print an A3 size document in Windows 8.1 or Windows 7
You cannot eject media or “Safely Remove Hardware and Eject Media” icon does not appear
You encounter some OneDrive issues in Windows 8.1 and Windows RT 8.1
New page cannot be displayed in OneNote app in Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1
Some MOV files cannot be played in Windows 8.1
Update to support AAC and LATM format audios in Windows 8.1 or Windows 8
Update to support UHS-1 SD cards in Windows 8.1
Update for MPEG4 parser to support YouTube DRM playback in Internet Explorer 11
Windows Hyper-V improvement for Linux virtual machines that have file systems
